body.p: A clone preserves the same structure of his original proto plus the extra packages installed, files copied, particular settings and custom user modifications. See (A) an example clone with the nginx package installed for web server role, and (B) another clone with the couchdb package installed for a database server role, both clones come from the same proto (many files/directories are omitted for simplicity):

example.codeblock: bin/ boot/ dev/ etc/ nginx/ fastcgi_params mime.types nginx.conf … init.d/ nginx var/ www/ nginx-default/ index.html 50x.html … log/ nginx/ lib/ nginx/ sbin/ nginx ...
example.title: Example A: clone with the nginx package installed

example.codeblock: bin/ boot/ dev/ etc/ default/ couchdb init.d/ couchdb couchdb/ default.ini local.ini ... /usr bin/ couchdb couchjs lib/ couchdb/ bin/ couchjs erlang/ lib/ ... share/ couchdb/ server/ main.js www/ _sidebar.html config.html ... ...
example.title: Example B: clone with the couchdb package installed
